document_title: What is dog tapeworm infection? Is it dangerous? Causes and symptoms
subsection_content:
Dog tapeworm disease develops silently in the body, without characteristic signs, so it is often confused with other diseases, so it is often not detected and treated promptly. After a period of parasiticism in the human body, especially in children, the disease will show signs of headache, fatigue, diarrhea, allergies, loss of appetite, digestive disorders, abdominal pain, especially a Some chronic diseases such as irritable colon syndrome, Crohn's disease, pseudoulcerative colitis, Celiac disease, pancreatitis, gallstones, lactose intolerance...
If not detected promptly, hydatid disease will cause many dangerous complications such as: frequent fatigue, weight loss, diarrhea, itching around the anus, epilepsy, weakness, and anemia. Therefore, when experiencing digestive disorders, allergies, etc., you should see a doctor to detect dog tapeworm infection early and treat it promptly.
